meanings.definition: The solid rock underlying loose deposits such as soil or gravel.
meanings.sent1: The builders dug deep to reach the bedrock for a stable foundation.
meanings.sent2: The house was built on a strong bedrock to prevent any shifting.
meanings.sent3: The bedrock decided to take a nap after holding up the ground all day.
meanings.sent4: Her unwavering support was the bedrock of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The bedrock stood firm against the relentless waves, a symbol of strength.

meanings.definition: The fundamental principles on which something is based.
meanings.sent1: Honesty and integrity are the bedrock of a good character.
meanings.sent2: Respect for others is the bedrock of a harmonious community.
meanings.sent3: The bedrock of his argument was a love for chocolate.
meanings.sent4: Trust forms the bedrock of any successful relationship.
meanings.sent5: Education is the bedrock upon which a bright future is built.
